segments.text: I can’t believe what I’m seeing right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and the woman doesn’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on that stool like it’s nothing, and it’s about to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the girl is just waiting for cookies, not even caring about the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying dishes like everything is fine, and it’s shocking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to fall, and it’s going to be a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and he’s still reaching like he’s starving.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the water spreading, and I’m just stunned by how calm everyone is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is so unexpected, and I don’t know what to do.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the garden outside is so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this is the most surprising thing I’ve ever seen.
segments.speaker: PAR
